intro: Layia glandulosa var. lutea, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are palmately divided and covered in small, glandular hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in desert and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
